poem:
Conflict Beyond Borders  

In the world's tangled weave,  
death masquerades as justice,  
rockets echoing grief  
across ancient lands.  
Children's laughter stolen,  
as power debates in shadows.  
Hearts unravel beneath  
a relentless desert sun;  
hope flickers thin as newsprint,  
yet still the soul seeks peace  
while leaders forge silence  
from the iron of their words.
